Basic details: Michael Green, a 28-year-old male, presents to the clinic with complaints of heel pain.
Vitals:
BP: 120/80 mm Hg
Temp: 98.4°F (36.9°C)
RR: 16/minute
HR: 72/minute, regular
Physical presentation:
Sit on the examination table and point to the heel of your right foot.
Exhibit discomfort when asked to walk or stand on tiptoes.
If asked about recent activities, mention increased running or physical activity.
If X-ray is mentioned by the examinee, ask, “What will an X-ray show?”
Challenging question: “Could this be something serious like a fracture or a tear?”
